meanings.definition: Not forming or involving a critical judgment or evaluation.
meanings.sent1: She gave an acritical response to the movie, simply enjoying it without analyzing it.
meanings.sent2: The acritical approach to the problem led to overlooking important details.
meanings.sent3: He took an acritical stance on the issue, choosing to see only the positives.
meanings.sent4: Her acritical view of the painting failed to appreciate the artist's technique.
meanings.sent5: The acritical attitude towards the project resulted in unexpected outcomes.

meanings.definition: Lacking the ability to make distinctions or judgments.
meanings.sent1: The acritical student struggled to differentiate between similar concepts.
meanings.sent2: His acritical nature made him easily influenced by others' opinions.
meanings.sent3: The acritical decision to buy the car without research proved costly.
meanings.sent4: Her acritical taste in music meant she enjoyed all genres equally.
meanings.sent5: The acritical mindset hindered his ability to make informed choices.
